materials.raw_text: La: 20 g, Pr: 15 g, Ru: 25 g, Sn: 25 g

sourcing.instructions: La (Lanthanum) - Obtain from a chemical supply company or rare earth metal supplier. Pr (Praseodymium) - Available from similar suppliers. Ru (Ruthenium) - Source from precious metal suppliers. Sn (Tin) - Available at general metal suppliers or online stores.
steps: La (Lanthanum) - Obtain from a chemical supply company or rare earth metal supplier. Pr (Praseodymium) - Available from similar suppliers. Ru (Ruthenium) - Source from precious metal suppliers. Sn (Tin) - Available at general metal suppliers or online stores.

1. Measure 20 g of La, 15 g of Pr, 25 g of Ru, and 25 g of Sn using an analytical balance. 2. Combine the metals in a clean, dry crucible. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to thoroughly mix the powders until uniform. 4. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable mold of dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 20 g of La, 15 g of Pr, 25 g of Ru, and 25 g of Sn using an analytical balance. 2. Combine the metals in a clean, dry crucible. 3. Use a pestle and mortar to thoroughly mix the powders until uniform. 4. Transfer the mixed powder into a suitable mold of dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches.

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the mold in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and amalgamation of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the mold in the furnace and maintain the temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and amalgamation of the materials.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally. This may take approximately 6-8 hours. 2. Do not attempt to remove the mold until it has cooled completely to avoid cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool to room temperature naturally. This may take approximately 6-8 hours. 2. Do not attempt to remove the mold until it has cooled completely to avoid cracking.

steps: 1. Once the material is cooled and solidified, carefully remove it from the mold. 2. Use sandpaper (grit 120 and 220) to smooth any rough edges and surfaces. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and resistance to oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once the material is cooled and solidified, carefully remove it from the mold. 2. Use sandpaper (grit 120 and 220) to smooth any rough edges and surfaces. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to enhance durability and resistance to oxidation.
